definition: to rush around everywhere/always active
Manchu ethnic group
to fill/full/filled/packed/fully/completely/quite/to reach the limit/to satisfy/satisfied/contented
day/sky/heaven
to fly

sentences.english: They are talking out of turn, they are throwing paper.
sentences.chinese: 他們口無遮攔，把紙張扔得滿天飛。

sentences.english: In the day, I see the snow, yellow and green in the white.
sentences.chinese: 白晝，白雪滿天飛，散在黃枝綠蕾。

sentences.english: In the center of the dusty city lies the famous Djemaa el Fna Square.
sentences.chinese: 在灰塵滿天飛的城中央，則是著名的德吉瑪廣場。

sentences.english: Scratch the subject of defence and acronym abbreviation and buzzwords fly out.
sentences.chinese: 話題觸及國防，縮合字，縮寫字和行話就滿天飛。

sentences.english: Rumor is everywhere, people are easy to believe it without testifying.
sentences.chinese: 謠言滿天飛，人們很容易相信即使沒有證據。

sentences.english: There s dirt on the affair between Jessica abd the manager.
sentences.chinese: 關於傑西卡和經理之間的風流韻事，流言滿天飛。

sentences.english: Predictions like this flew at the summit.
sentences.chinese: 在這次峯會上，類似的預言滿天飛。

definition: (of sound) to never stop/to fall incessantly on the ear/to linger on
lit. a deluge of heavenly flowers (idiom)/fig. extravagant embellishments/hype
lit. hiding the sky and covering the earth (idiom); fig. earth-shattering/omnipresent/of universal importance
to vanish/to disappear from the face of the earth
(Tw) from time to time/frequently
to keep one's calm in the face of the unexpected/not to wonder at strange sights
to damn/to curse/to revile
frightening words to scare people (idiom); alarmist talk/reds under the beds
to start a rumor
to be of no interest to anyone (idiom)
rumors and slanders (idiom); gossip/lies and slanders
to abuse roundly
one after another (idiom)/in quick succession
a legendary tree that sheds coins when shaken/a source of easy money (idiom)
to harbor evil designs/to harbor malicious intentions
to carry within it/to be mixed in/to slip sth in/to intersperse/(hydrology etc) to entrain/to smuggle/notes smuggled into an exam
